cloud_amount_below_1000ft_ASL.title: cloud amount below 1000ft ASL
cloud_amount_below_1000ft_ASL.description: Fraction of horizontal grid square occupied by cloud cover below 1,000 feet above sea level.

cloud_amount_of_high_cloud.title: cloud amount of high cloud
cloud_amount_of_high_cloud.description: Fraction of horizontal grid square occupied by cloud in the high-level cloud height range; from 5,574m (~18,000ft) to 13,608m (~44,500ft).

cloud_amount_of_low_cloud.title: cloud amount of low cloud
cloud_amount_of_low_cloud.description: Fraction on horizontal grid square occupied by cloud in the low-level cloud height range: from 111m (~350ft) to 1,949m (~6,500ft).

cloud_amount_of_medium_cloud.title: cloud amount of medium cloud
cloud_amount_of_medium_cloud.description: A fraction of horizontal grid square occupied by cloud in the mid-level cloud height range; from 1,949m (~6,500ft) to 5,574m (~18,000ft).

cloud_amount_of_total_cloud.title: cloud amount of total cloud
cloud_amount_of_total_cloud.description: Fraction of horizontal grid square occupied by cloud as diagnosed by the model cloud scheme. This is for the whole atmosphere column as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere.

fog_fraction_at_screen_level.title: fog fraction at screen level
fog_fraction_at_screen_level.description: Fog means a visibility of 1000 m or lower. The reduction in visibility is caused by water droplets or minute ice crystals forming close to the surface. This quantity represents the fraction of horizontal grid square occupied by fog. An alternative interpretation is that this represents the fractional probability of fog being present at any location in the grid square.

precipitation_rate.title: precipitation rate
precipitation_rate.description: Instantaneous rate at which liquid water (as a depth) is being deposited on the surface.

pressure_at_mean_sea_level.title: pressure at mean sea level
pressure_at_mean_sea_level.description: Air pressure at mean sea level which is close to the geoid in sea areas. Air pressure at sea level is the quantity often abbreviated as MSLP or PMSL.

radiation_flux_in_longwave_downward_at_s.title: radiation flux in longwave downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_longwave_downward_at_s.description: Longwave radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines "flux" implies per unit area called "flux density" in physics.

radiation_flux_in_shortwave_direct_downw.title: radiation flux in shortwave direct downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_shortwave_direct_downw.description: Shortwave radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground. "Direct" means that the radiation has followed a direct path from the sun and is alternatively known as "direct insolation". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines "flux" implies per unit area called "flux density" in physics.

radiation_flux_in_uv_downward_at_surface.title: radiation flux in uv downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_uv_downward_at_surface.description: Ultraviolet radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines flux implies per unit area called "flux density" in physics.

relative_humidity_at_screen_level.title: relative humidity at screen level
relative_humidity_at_screen_level.description: Fractional relative humidity (ratio of the partial pressure of water vapour to the equilibrium vapour pressure of water) at screen level (1.5m above the surface.)

snow_depth_water_equivalent.title: snow depth water equivalent
snow_depth_water_equivalent.description: Liquid water equivalent (LWE) depth of the snow lying on the surface (ground). Typically, water is 10 times as dense as snow so multiplying by 10 gives an approximate depth of the snow, although wet snow can be significantly denser and powder snow much less dense.

temperature_at_screen_level_max.title: temperature at screen level max
temperature_at_screen_level_max.description: Maximum instantaneous air temperature at screen level (1.5m).

temperature_at_screen_level_min.title: temperature at screen level min
temperature_at_screen_level_min.description: Minimum instantaneous air temperature at screen level (1.5m).

temperature_at_surface.title: temperature at surface
temperature_at_surface.description: Temperature at the surface interface between the air and the ground.

temperature_of_dew_point_at_screen_level.title: temperature of dew point at screen level
temperature_of_dew_point_at_screen_level.description: Dew point temperature (temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity) at screen level.

visibility_at_screen_level.title: visibility at screen level
visibility_at_screen_level.description: Distance at which a known object can be seen horizontally from screen level (1.5m).

wind_direction_at_10m.title: wind direction at 10m
wind_direction_at_10m.description: Mean wind direction is equivalent to the mean direction observed over the 10 minutes preceding the validity time. In meteorological reports the direction of the wind vector is given as the direction from which it is blowing. 10m wind is the considered surface wind.

wind_gust_at_10m.title: wind gust at 10m
wind_gust_at_10m.description: The gust speed is equivalent to the maximum 3 second mean wind speed observed over the 10 minutes preceding validity time. 10m wind is the considered surface wind.

wind_gust_at_10m_max.title: wind gust at 10m max
wind_gust_at_10m_max.description: Maximum diagnosed instantaneous wind gust at 10m. This can be considered as the extreme wind speed that might be experienced in this period.

wind_speed_at_10m.title: wind speed at 10m
wind_speed_at_10m.description: Mean wind speed is equivalent to the mean speed observed over the 10 minutes preceding the validity time. 10m wind is the considered surface wind.

rainfall_rate_from_convection.title: rainfall rate from convection
rainfall_rate_from_convection.description: Instantaneous rate at which rain, produced by the model convection scheme, is being deposited on the surface.

snowfall_rate_from_convection.title: snowfall rate from convection
snowfall_rate_from_convection.description: Rate at which liquid water equivalent (LWE) snow, produced by the model convection scheme, is being deposited on the surface.

rainfall_rate_from_convection_max.title: rainfall rate from convection max
rainfall_rate_from_convection_max.description: Maximum instantaneous rate at which rain, produced by the model convection scheme, is being deposited on the surface.

snowfall_rate_from_convection_max.title: snowfall rate from convection max
snowfall_rate_from_convection_max.description: Maximum instantaneous rate at which liquid water equivalent (LWE) snow, produced by the model convection scheme, is being deposited on the surface.

snowfall_rate_from_convection_mean.title: snowfall rate from convection mean
snowfall_rate_from_convection_mean.description: Mean rate at which liquid water equivalent (LWE) snow, produced by the model convection scheme, is being deposited on the surface.

hail_fall_accumulation.title: hail fall accumulation
hail_fall_accumulation.description: Implied depth of hail (as liquid water equivalent) which has been deposited on the surface.

hail_fall_rate.title: hail fall rate
hail_fall_rate.description: Instantaneous rate at which hail (as liquid water equivalent) is being deposited on the surface.

height_AGL_at_cloud_base_where_cloud_cov.title: height AGL at cloud base where cloud cover 2p5 oktas
height_AGL_at_cloud_base_where_cloud_cov.description: Height above ground level at cloud base where cloud cover is 2.5 oktas (approximately 31% coverage).

height_AGL_at_freezing_level.title: height AGL at freezing level
height_AGL_at_freezing_level.description: Height above ground level at the 0°C isotherm (freezing level).

height_AGL_at_wet_bulb_freezing_level.title: height AGL at wet bulb freezing level
height_AGL_at_wet_bulb_freezing_level.description: Height above ground level at the wet bulb freezing level.

landsea_mask.title: landsea mask
landsea_mask.description: Binary mask indicating land (1) or sea (0) surface type.

lightning_flash_accumulation.title: lightning flash accumulation
lightning_flash_accumulation.description: Accumulated count of lightning flashes in the grid square.

radiation_flux_in_shortwave_diffuse_down.title: radiation flux in shortwave diffuse downward at surface
radiation_flux_in_shortwave_diffuse_down.description: Diffuse shortwave radiation at the surface from above directed at the ground. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines "flux" implies per unit area called "flux density" in physics.

sensible_heat_flux_at_surface.title: sensible heat flux at surface
sensible_heat_flux_at_surface.description: Exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air; also called "turbulent" heat flux. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines "flux" implies per unit area called "flux density" in physics. Upwards is positive; negative is downward.

snowfall_accumulation.title: snowfall accumulation
snowfall_accumulation.description: Implied depth of snow (as liquid water equivalent) which has been deposited on the surface.
